other_tests.findings: Renal amyloidosis diagnosed based on Congo red positivity with birefringence under polarized light. Two out of 12 glomeruli showed global sclerosis. All glomeruli had hypocellular tufts with mesangial areas expanded by deposits of homogeneous material, which were Congo red positive and weakly periodic acid Schiff positive.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Two years after kidney biopsy, the patient developed renal failure and underwent a combined kidney and liver transplant. Two years after transplantation, she has normal renal function.
